title: Subdomain Takeover - https://competition.shopify.com/

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
Dear Shopify Security Team,

The Shopify.com subdomain competition.shopify.com was vulnerable to a subdomain takeover as it was pointing to an unclaimed Heroku service through the CNAME competition.shopify.com.herokudns.com, while the custom domain 'competition.shopify.com' was unclaimed in Heroku.

To prevent an attacker from claiming the domain and using it for malicious purposes, and also as a proof of concept, I have claimed the domain in Heroku and uploaded a proof of concept, which you can view here: https://competition.shopify.com/329a01fddb5a552265170b02c579c85f.html (I've also redirected visitors of the index page to https://shopify.com)

To fix the issue, there are two possible solutions. If you would like to re-start using Heroku with this domain, I can remove the custom domain from my Heroku app. Otherwise you may choose to delete the entry from your DNS servers, which will also fix the problem.

## Impact

I don't think I need to go into the security implications of a malicious attacker hijacking the domain, but here are a few possible attacks that could be performed if a malicious attacker were to hijack the domain:
* The ability for an attacker to execute JavaScript to steal user cookies and/or using the site as an endpoint for browser exploitation.
* Using the subdomain as a fool-proof phishing site (stealing Shopify customer/employee credentials). SSL has also been enabled, giving end users more trust of the site.
* Defacement of the website, or deployment of a fake site, such as a fake Shopify competition that harvests customer credit card details.
* Spreading of malware, or use of the domain as a C2 server.

I look forward to hearing back from your team.

Regards,
t4
vulnerability_information_html:
Dear Shopify Security Team,

The Shopify.com subdomain competition.shopify.com was vulnerable to a subdomain takeover as it was pointing to an unclaimed Heroku service through the CNAME competition.shopify.com.herokudns.com, while the custom domain 'competition.shopify.com' was unclaimed in Heroku.

To prevent an attacker from claiming the domain and using it for malicious purposes, and also as a proof of concept, I have claimed the domain in Heroku and uploaded a proof of concept, which you can view here: https://competition.shopify.com/329a01fddb5a552265170b02c579c85f.html (I've also redirected visitors of the index page to https://shopify.com)

To fix the issue, there are two possible solutions. If you would like to re-start using Heroku with this domain, I can remove the custom domain from my Heroku app. Otherwise you may choose to delete the entry from your DNS servers, which will also fix the problem.

Impact

I don't think I need to go into the security implications of a malicious attacker hijacking the domain, but here are a few possible attacks that could be performed if a malicious attacker were to hijack the domain:

  • The ability for an attacker to execute JavaScript to steal user cookies and/or using the site as an endpoint for browser exploitation.
  • Using the subdomain as a fool-proof phishing site (stealing Shopify customer/employee credentials). SSL has also been enabled, giving end users more trust of the site.
  • Defacement of the website, or deployment of a fake site, such as a fake Shopify competition that harvests customer credit card details.
  • Spreading of malware, or use of the domain as a C2 server.

I look forward to hearing back from your team.

Regards,
t4

activities.message: Hi @llt4l, thank you for the report and responsibly taking steps to demonstrate the vulnerability discreetly by using an unguessable URL and redirecting the domain. This is a great example of how to demonstrate impact professionally, in my humble opinion. I'm triaging this now while we get it fixed.
activities.markdown_message: Hi @llt4l, thank you for the report and responsibly taking steps to demonstrate the vulnerability discreetly by using an unguessable URL and redirecting the domain. This is a great example of how to demonstrate impact professionally, in my humble opinion. I'm triaging this now while we get it fixed.

activities.message: Hi @llt4l, it looks like when you claimed the subdomain, a Lets Encrypt certificate was generated for it as well. Can you please revoke that?
activities.markdown_message: Hi @llt4l, it looks like when you claimed the subdomain, a Lets Encrypt certificate was generated for it as well. Can you please revoke that?

activities.message: We're awarding an initial 500$ on triage, and we'll evaluate the final amount after we resolve the issue.
activities.markdown_message: We're awarding an initial 500$ on triage, and we'll evaluate the final amount after we resolve the issue.

activities.message:
Hi @shopify-peteryaworski, 

Thanks for the feedback. I had initially enabled SSL on the Heroku app to show increased impact, but I've now gone and disabled it. Please do let me know if this has solved the problem, as I'm unsure whether Heroku have revoked the certificate on the back-end or whether it's just disabled SSL access to the app and left the certificate as is.

Apologies for any inconveniences caused.

Regards,
t4
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @shopify-peteryaworski,

Thanks for the feedback. I had initially enabled SSL on the Heroku app to show increased impact, but I've now gone and disabled it. Please do let me know if this has solved the problem, as I'm unsure whether Heroku have revoked the certificate on the back-end or whether it's just disabled SSL access to the app and left the certificate as is.

Apologies for any inconveniences caused.

Regards,
t4

activities.message: Also, thanks for the bounty team @shopify :)
activities.markdown_message: Also, thanks for the bounty team @shopify :)

activities.message:
Hi @llt4l, we deployed a fix for this shortly after your report and took the extra time to review other subdomains. This should be resolved now. 

Our next round of bounty decisions should happen this week so you can expect to hear back soon. Thanks again for your report.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @llt4l, we deployed a fix for this shortly after your report and took the extra time to review other subdomains. This should be resolved now.

Our next round of bounty decisions should happen this week so you can expect to hear back soon. Thanks again for your report.

activities.message: We're awarding an additional 250$ for a total of 750$. Thank you again for this report!
activities.markdown_message: We're awarding an additional 250$ for a total of 750$. Thank you again for this report!

activities.message: Thanks for the bounty Shopify Team :).

summaries.content: @llt4l discovered a dangling CNAME pointed to Heroku which allowed them to claim `competition.shopify.com`. We removed the DNS entry immediately and took the extra time to review and clean up some other records. As a result, we awarded an extra $250 on top of the typical $500 bounty.
summaries.content_html: @llt4l discovered a dangling CNAME pointed to Heroku which allowed them to claim competition.shopify.com. We removed the DNS entry immediately and took the extra time to review and clean up some other records. As a result, we awarded an extra $250 on top of the typical $500 bounty.
